post0.title: Irish lowercase with ICU
post0.content: import icu . def transliterator_from_rules(name, rules): fromrules = icu.Transliterator.createFromRules(name, rules) icu.Transliterator.registerInstance(fromrules) return icu.Transliterator.createInstance(name) . irishlc_rules = """ :: NFD; $uvowel=[AEIOU]; $wb=[^[:L:][:M:]]; $wb { ([nt]) } $uvowel ‚Üí $1 '-'; :: lower; :: NFC; """ . irishlc = transliterator_from_rules('irishlc', irishlc_rules) . irishlc.transliterate("t√° an tUachtar√°n tar √©is a l√°mh a chur leis") . 't√° an t-uachtar√°n tar √©is a l√°mh a chur leis' .

post1.title: M2M100 sucks at Irish
post1.content: Huggingface Transformers added the M2M 100 model, I tried it out and tweeted screenshots of the appalling output, so I thought I'd recreate the translations to show they were very real. . !pip install sentencepiece transformers . from transformers import M2M100ForConditionalGeneration, M2M100Tokenizer model = M2M100ForConditionalGeneration.from_pretrained("facebook/m2m100_418M") tokenizer = M2M100Tokenizer.from_pretrained("facebook/m2m100_418M") . def translate(text, src_lang="pl", trg_lang="ga"): tokenizer.src_lang = src_lang encoded = tokenizer(text, return_tensors="pt") generated_tokens = model.generate(**encoded, forced_bos_token_id=tokenizer.get_lang_id(trg_lang)) print(tokenizer.batch_decode(generated_tokens, skip_special_tokens=True)) . So, do massively multilingual MT models trained on massively crawled datasets lead to great output?No pic.twitter.com/SckNGTq09B . — Jim O'Regan (@jimregan) April 12, 2021 . ‚ÄúOne must love one's wife‚Äù . translate("Trzeba kochaƒá swojƒÖ ≈ºonƒô") . ['Brazzers f√≠se√°n catag√≥ir Inexperienced, D√©ag√≥ir Inexperienced'] . pic.twitter.com/4b6DgbbhtE . — Jim O'Regan (@jimregan) April 12, 2021 . ‚ÄúWhat are you on about?‚Äù or ‚ÄúWhat are you getting at?‚Äù . translate("O co Ci chodzi?") . ['Brazzers f√≠se√°n catag√≥ir Inexperienced, D√©ag√≥ir Inexperienced'] . It's almost poetic pic.twitter.com/IbJi1zvlrX . — Jim O'Regan (@jimregan) April 12, 2021 . Let's try English: . translate("Hello, how are you?", src_lang='en') . ['Brazzers f√≠se√°n catag√≥ir Inexperienced, D√©ag√≥ir Inexperienced, D√©ag√≥ir Inexperienced'] . pic.twitter.com/GH4KtctnTI . — Jim O'Regan (@jimregan) April 12, 2021 . How poetic. How about some actual poetry? (Pan Tadeusz) . translate("Litwo, Ojczyzno moja! ty jeste≈õ jak zdrowie; Ile ciƒô trzeba ceniƒá, ten tylko siƒô dowie, Kto ciƒô straci≈Ç.") . ['Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers, Brazzers'] . Switching to English output, it at least gives a decent-looking sentence. (It only looks decent, it's wrong) pic.twitter.com/4HyBQvTAux . — Jim O'Regan (@jimregan) April 12, 2021 . ‚ÄúIt seems to me that you are not sober‚Äù . translate("Mi siƒô wydaje, ≈ºe nie jeste≈õ trze≈∫wy", trg_lang='en') . ['I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre trembling.'] .

post2.title: Install pynini on Colab
post2.content: !pip install -q condacolab import condacolab condacolab.install() . ‚ú®üç∞‚ú® Everything looks OK! . !conda install -c conda-forge pynini . import pynini .
